medical_history.chief_complaint: Combined pituitary hormone deficiencies due to Pituitary stalk interruption syndrome (PSIS).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms presented in infancy with transient hypoglycemia within the first 36 hours of life, followed by diagnosis of central congenital hypothyroidism. Magnetic resonance imaging of the brain indicated small anterior pituitary, ectopic posterior pituitary, and thin interrupted stalk. Hydrocortisone replacement started at 6 weeks due to low serum cortisol levels, and testosterone was given at 8 months for small phallus. Growth hormone therapy began at 2 years and 9 months due to lack of statural growth.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Central congenital hypothyroidism and combined pituitary hormone deficiencies from infancy.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents are carriers for Gaucher disease and familial hyperinsulinism. The unaffected sister carries only the PROKR2 missense mutation.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is of Ashkenazi Jewish heritage and was conceived by in vitro fertilization with targeted preimplantation genetic diagnosis.
